reasoning: SIDS incidence ~0.55 per 1000 live births globally in 2005 (post Back-to-Sleep era). With ~133M births/year globally, approximately 73,000 SIDS deaths/year. Reported per 100k infants (0-1 year population ~133M, or ~1.7% of 8B = 136M) = ~54 per 100k infants. Converted to general population incidence: ~7.5 per 100k person-years. High geographic variation (0.2-0.8 per 1000 births).
source: Hauck FR et al. (2008). International trends in sudden infant death syndrome: stabilization of rates requires further action. Pediatrics. 122(3):660-666
